text: have you won is Alan here today I will
be cooking a vegetarian soup with
pumpkin mushrooms and peanuts
if myself a strange combination when you
hear it for the first time but when you
give it a try I'm sure you're gonna fall
in love with it so let's begin you're
gonna need one gram of straw mushrooms
soft in salted water to clean and then
remove the end parts have a cup or 70
gram of raw peanuts today I use fresh
straw mushrooms but you can also buy it
in a can you can also use other kinds of
mushrooms that you like cut the smaller
ones in half and the bigger ones in
quarters
then season the mushrooms with a
tablespoon of the white part of spring
onion minced a teaspoon of mushroom
seasonings and some pepper if you are
Buddhist vegetarians you can use leek
instead of spring onion mix well and set
aside for about 15 minutes cut the
pumpkin into large cubes and then remove
the fibrous part in the center and peel
off the skin
cut the pumpkin into 1/4 2-inch cubes I
use the wavy Knight to cut so it looks
prettier after soaking the raw peanuts
in water for a few hours remove the
silky skin and then roughly crush them
in a mortar and pestle or in a plastic
bag in a saucepan heat 1 tablespoons of
vegetable oil and fry some green onion
until fragrant then adding the mushrooms
and stir-fry until cooked it would take
about 2 to 3 minutes
then transfer the stir-fry mushrooms
back to the bowl and 1 litre or 4 cups
water into the pot and teaspoon of salt
add the peanuts and cook for about 15
minutes until is quite soft occasionally
skimming off the foam also add a
teaspoon of mushrooms or vegetable stock
at the 50 minutes adding the pumpkins
and cover the lid cook for another 15
minutes until the pumpkin is soft when
you can easily break the pumpkins with a
chopstick and as when is cooked
now at the stir-fry mushroom back to the
soup pot and then season again to your
taste with some more accordion mushroom
seasonings or salt to your liking
finally garnish with some spring onion
cilantro or sweet basil and we are
finished the pumpkin is really soft and
creamy the peanut really adds a very
interesting crunchy texture and the
sweetness to the soup if you liked this
video don't forget to click like and
subscribe to my channel for more
delicious Vietnamese food if you decide
to give it recipe or try to forget to
take a photo of your food and upload on
Instagram Facebook Google+ Twitter with
the hashtag Helen recipes so I can
feature your foods in my future video
just like these awesome dishes that I
have received recently thank you for
watching bye
